Key Match Events: Travis Head and Mitch Marsh smashed powerplay record
Brandon McMullen was out to a fine running catch by Tim David, off Sean Abbott, for 59 off 42 balls
Brad Currie held on to a steepling catch off his own bowling
Tim David contributed 17 runs in a seven-ball cameo
Ben Duckett had opener Michael Jones out for one
Bartlett, Hardie, Abbott and Adam Zampa took one apiece
Green claimed two in two balls
Pre-Game Insights: Inglis seemed to be playing a different game to most other batters in foggy conditions
Australia captain Mitchell Marsh lost the toss and Richie Berrington inserted the tourists
Any prospect of Travis Head repeating his pyrotechnics from Wednesday was ended
Post-Match Reflections: Marsh said: 'A really good game of cricket â€“ the way Inglis and Green got us out of trouble was excellent. Josh was just unbelievable in another all-round performance from us.'

Marsh said: 'We have a young group of guys getting opportunities with flexibility in the tour. There might be a couple of changes tomorrow, will have to ask the coach. We have a chance to win 3-0 and tomorrow is another opportunity.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia lead the series 2-0 with one match to play
Any prospect of Travis Head repeating his pyrotechnics from Wednesday, however, were ended when the recalled Brad Currie got one to nip back and clip the top of middle stump
Others: The final match of the three-match series is in Edinburgh on Saturday
